Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Ron_G Welcome aboard. No need to panic is right. I _think_ you'd be clinically classified as T1c. The family is always the problem, LOL! Do you have a 'PSA history' and where you located? Ron Thanks to all with the info and questions. Have been getting PSA for over 10 years. Only have records for past 4 years. Also had DRE at least 3 times in that period of over 10 years. 8-2012 PSA 2.4 8-2013 PSA 2.8 8-2014 PSA 3.2 8-2015 PSA 4.3 Was DRE in Oct 2015 Urologist said he felt a nodule on right side. Doc said I needed a biopsy. I said ok and waited till after the new year for insurance reasons. When biopsy he asked if I ever had a urinary infection. Due to calcified area were he thought was nodule. He said no nodule. And I said no never had one that I am aware of. He said I would have remembered if I had one. My location is WI 60 miles away from any lap scope surgery so open would be my choice. My Urologist has done many and it would be within 2 miles of home. Was planning another PSA in April. So I meant not to mean wait and see. I would continue active surveillance.
Posts.Title: Just Received Diagnosis Active Sur Route I Think

Posts.Content: Biopsy Jan 4 2016 Jan 8 2016 Happy New Year You Have Prostate Cancer. 12 Biopsy 2 Positive Normal Size Prostate Maybe Even Small Side Doc Said PSA in Aug 2012 2.4 PSA in Aug 2013 2.8 PSA in Aug 2014 3.2 PSA in Aug 2015 4.3 Gleason 3+3 =6 A.Left Lateral 1. Moderately Differentiated Prostatic Adenocarcinoma Gleason 3+3=6 2. Definitive Perineural Invasion Is Seen 3. The Tumor Involves 1 Core And 15% Of Biopsied Tissue. d. Left Prostate Left Mid 1. Moderately Differentiated Prostatic Adenocarcinoma. Gleason 3+3=6 2. No Definitive Perineural Invasion is seen. 3. The Left Tumor Involves 1 Core and less than 5% of the Biopsied Tissue. So Doc says you have choices. Over whelming research and paths you can take on this. I am 58 in excellent health. 160 pounds 5'10. Feel great. Workout 6 days a week light weight training stationary bike and walking. Smoke free 18 years. Doc says I have option of another PSA 6 months. And another PSA 6 months after that. And even another biopsy 6 months after that if I wish. He not in a hurry to gut me and get paid I guess! At this point I do not want to run before I walk with this. Am leaning towards wait and see. However family think its a bad idea. Amazing how many people think I need to get gutted asap like thats the cure all for this. And your life returns to normal. Well anyways from what I have read. I appear to be a very early stage and no need to panic. Doc says Stage 1 but did not say a b or c. My brother gone at 50 lung cancer,Grams lung cancer,1 Aunt lung cancer,1 Uncle Colon cancer ,2 Uncles esophagus cancer so I have seen the carnage some cancers can bring. Mom and Dad 8 siblings each with cancer both sides. Anyways feel free to offer any advice. And I enjoy reading others paths they have taken. Thank you Steve
Posts.Title: Just Received Diagnosis Active Sur Route I Think

Posts.Title: Just Received Diagnosis Active Sur Route I Think

Posts.Content: As stated this will be my last post after my 2-09-16 Radical Prostatectomy Surgery. Day 13 no urine leaks past 2 days. No pad. Kegel exercises working and a good Surgeon. Taking Viagra 3 days now no erection at this time. Not giving up on ED but was never my main concern. Urine leaking was my number one goal to avoid for recovery. No pain medication since 2-15-16 Final path report Gleason score went to 7 as stated last posting. Cancer of Prostate with low recurrence risk T1-2a Gleason <7 & PSA < 10. 30 percent of Prostate full of Cancer. Doc told me 2-18-16 when staples came out. Was good that I did surgery when I did. He feels another year and the Cancer would have been out of the box. Other than that I feel great. Looking forward to getting back to my weight training in 2 more weeks and some Harley rides. Thank you all for sharing your thoughts. And may you all have a good long life of Cancer free ahead. And may we all remind our fellow man the importance of a PSA at age 40 and above each year. Take care all this is my final posting. Sincerely Steve
Posts.Title: My Last Post See Active Surveillance For Prior Posting
